package cache

import (
	
	
)
BufferLRU implements an object cache with an LRU eviction policy and a maximum size (measured in object size).
type BufferLRU struct {
	MaxSize FileSize

	actualSize FileSize
	ll         *list.List
	cache      map[int64]*list.Element
	mut        sync.Mutex
}
NewBufferLRU creates a new BufferLRU with the given maximum size. The maximum size will never be exceeded.
func ( FileSize) *BufferLRU {
	return &BufferLRU{MaxSize: }
}
NewBufferLRUDefault creates a new BufferLRU with the default cache size.
func () *BufferLRU {
	return &BufferLRU{MaxSize: DefaultMaxSize}
}

type buffer struct {
	Key   int64
	Slice []byte
}
Put puts a buffer into the cache. If the buffer is already in the cache, it will be marked as used. Otherwise, it will be inserted. A buffers might be evicted to make room for the new one.
func ( *BufferLRU) ( int64,  []byte) {
	.mut.Lock()
	defer .mut.Unlock()

	if .cache == nil {
		.actualSize = 0
		.cache = make(map[int64]*list.Element, 1000)
		.ll = list.New()
	}

	 := FileSize(len())
	if ,  := .cache[];  {
in this case bufSize is a delta: new size - old size
		 -= FileSize(len(.Slice))
		.ll.MoveToFront()
		.Value = buffer{, }
	} else {
		if  > .MaxSize {
			return
		}
		 := .ll.PushFront(buffer{, })
		.cache[] = 
	}

	.actualSize += 
	for .actualSize > .MaxSize {
		 := .ll.Back()
		 := .Value.(buffer)
		 := FileSize(len(.Slice))

		.ll.Remove()
		delete(.cache, .Key)
		.actualSize -= 
	}
}
Get returns a buffer by its key. It marks the buffer as used. If the buffer is not in the cache, (nil, false) will be returned.
func ( *BufferLRU) ( int64) ([]byte, bool) {
	.mut.Lock()
	defer .mut.Unlock()

	,  := .cache[]
	if ! {
		return nil, false
	}

	.ll.MoveToFront()
	return .Value.(buffer).Slice, true
}
Clear the content of this buffer cache.
func ( *BufferLRU) () {
	.mut.Lock()
	defer .mut.Unlock()

	.ll = nil
	.cache = nil
	.actualSize = 0


The pages are generated with Golds v0.3.2-preview. (GOOS=darwin GOARCH=amd64)
Golds is a Go 101 project developed by Tapir Liu.
PR and bug reports are welcome and can be submitted to the issue list.
